Post_Title: Refused my mother to let me touch me between my legs today. She's now pouting and told me that I can never hug her again. Lol
post_text:
Can't believe I even have to write this.

For years my mom had this weird "joke" of touching my behind. She likes to pinch it, go with her fingers up my exposed legs, or "tickle me on the insight of my legs near my crotch. She did this for years and for years I hated this, but she always told me "oh, my mother used to do this", or "you're my child, I can do this", or "I'm your mother. Calm down, it's nothing sexual."

Well, today I had enough. When she tried to tickle me, I slapped her hand away and told her off. Told her straight that I don't want to be touched there. She responded the same comments, but I said "no. I don't want to be touched. I have a right to not get touched if I don't want to."

She probably didn't learn her lesson, but I still am kinda proud of myself. As you read, I currently have to endure her "pouting season" rn. In the next time, I'll have to put up with random aggressions, mocking jokes and dramatic acts, when I'll accidentally run into her.

I don't care though.

_Edit_ :So first of all, thanks for all the kind words! I really didn't think a lot about my progression, but apparently it struck a nerve with people.

However, just to clear a few things up a bit:

1. A lot of people seem to believe I'm a guy and that I still go to school. No, I am a girl and  go to university. However, even when I told teachers when I was still at school they either didn't believe me, or brushed it off as me overreacting.

2. No, I sadly can't call CPS. Long story short; I'm from a place where CPS is rather lazy. Being 18yo most people believe I can "just move out" and in general I'm from a culture where people tend to stick to their own problems. And even if they'd help me, my mother is pretty good at lying to people

3. She's not a paedophile, but definitely fucked up. She has a lot of crooked ideas around sexuality like f.ex  thinking cheating is natural and everyone who denies doing it, simply lies about it

Threads.Reply_Text: Good for you for standing up to her. No normal person ever would touch someone there. I bet she never did it while there were people who are not family members present because she knew it was wrong.

Replies.Reply_Text:
Yes, exactly. Good for you and your autonomy.

Tbh, she probably does weird controlling shit while hugging too, so you might be dodging a bullet. Find chosen family who respect your autonomy for hugs.

I used to go to school and share great hugs with my friends.

>Good for you for standing up to her. No normal person ever would touch someone there. I bet she never did it while there were people who are not family members present because she knew it was wrong.

Which reminds me of the saying, "we are only as sick as our secrets." To me, that includes secrets that others are trying to make me keep.
I have to disagree. Imagine if it were OP's dad taking these actions - that is pedophilic. There are women who are pedophiles, and OP's mother is one.

That also sounded weird to me. :\\ I've been noticing more and more weird comments like this, trying to excuse this kind of behavior whenever someone mentions sexual abuse on this sub. It correlates with the number of real survivors on here connecting the dots of their abuse, and realizing they had a pedophile as a parent.
A relationship between spouses is vastly different than that of a parent and child. It’s okay to touch your spouse sexually with their consent. It is NOT okay to touch your child sexually.

I get that. Even so, it was a weirdly inappropriate comment to make given the overall conversation happening here. Spousal touching wasn’t being discussed. Unless I’m incorrect, “no normal person would do that “ was in reference to a parent in a parent/child relationship.

I think you’re being downvoted because your comment came across as flippant and disrespectful given the nature of the conversation.
It just wasn’t an appropriate comment to make given the conversation.

Defensiveness is in action. You made a mistake. Forgive yourself and use this as an opportunity to recognise how defensiveness makes you double down and become more isolated and angry when a simple mistake could easily be sorted.  We all do it.

To clarify, you think your interpretation of “any normal person “ is absolute. It is not given the context of the original post.

This comment has been removed because it goes against our rule, "no advocating abusive practices". This situation is clearly not the same as yours where consent is given. Regardless, it's inappropriate to make the situation about you right now, and it doesn't help to support OP.

This is the fourth time you've broken our rules, and you insisted on pushing back and being snarky/unkind to other users. You've been permanently banned.
